channel.title: Args help =S
channel.description:
i have a command im making and i want it to have 3 args the command name the target player and a bunch of random words separated by spaces ex: ::lolowned myplayername i like pie
heres all you should need to help me =S btw sorry im playing with colors abit :P
problems in red if i were to type the command in game it would read it as command target and first word of the sentence in this case its i i want it to read it as command target and i like pie i do not want preset words i want to be abel to change the i like pie to whatever in game without additional codeing
String[] args = command.split(" "); String player = (args[1]); String Texts1 = (args[2]);
thx to whoever ends up helping :| Teehee i like that smiley

item.title: Args help =S
item.dc:creator: @demon_fox337 demon fox337
item.description:
@demon_fox337 wrote:

[quote=“Epic Steve, post:5, topic:392202”][quote author=demon fox337 link=topic=489367.msg3577776#msg3577776 date=1303564353]
urgh i hate that variable or whatever it is the i lol i have no clue what it does and thus it confuzzles me :eek:
[/quote]
What one?

The variable i is just a counter. It increases by one everytime the loop completes.
The variable str is just a String. After the loop completes all its iterations the str variable will hold what ever you have typed. eg: If I typed ::somecommand hello lol this is well cool. The str variable would hold “lol this is well cool”.[/quote]
thx for that lol was talking bout the i

and thx to mr solution ninja lool

Read full topic

item.title: Args help =S
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

demon fox337:

urgh i hate that variable or whatever it is the i lol i have no clue what it does and thus it confuzzles me :eek:

What one?

The variable i is just a counter. It increases by one everytime the loop completes.
The variable str is just a String. After the loop completes all its iterations the str variable will hold what ever you have typed. eg: If I typed ::somecommand hello lol this is well cool. The str variable would hold “lol this is well cool”.

Read full topic

item.title: Args help =S
item.dc:creator: @nadnerb_doow nadnerb_doow
item.description:
@nadnerb_doow wrote:

String[] args = command.split(" ");
String player = args[1];
String text = command.substring((args[0].length() + player.length() + 2));

The substring method, in this case, isolates a certain part of the string, starting at the character position you give it. So if I had a string that said “this is an excellent string”, and I called substring(8) on that string, it would remove the first 8 characters (spaces included), leaving me with “an excellent string”. So, the snippet I provided adds the length of the command, plus the length of the target’s name, then adds 2 (for spaces between the arguments), and removes everything before that point.

Edit: bah, ninja’d by a better solution damnit

Read full topic

item.title: Args help =S
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

Loop though the args array starting at pos 2 and append all the text (and a space) to the end of an empty string. eg;

String str = "";
for(int i = 2; i < args.length; i++) {
    str += args[i] + " ";
}

That code probably wont work, (although it might!) but it’s the same concept.

Read full topic
